lines: My memory reaches back even to the Elder Days.
Eärendil was my sire, who was born in Gondolin before its fall; and my mother was Elwing, daughter of Dior, son of Lúthien of Doriath.
I have seen three ages in the West of the world, and many defeats, and many fruitless victories.

I was the herald of Gil-galad and marched with his host. I was at the Battle of Dagorlad before the Black Gate of Mordor, where we had the mastery: for the Spear of Gil-galad and the Sword of Elendil, Aeglos and Narsil, none could withstand.

I beheld the defeat of Sauron on the slopes of Orodruin, where Gil-galad died, and Elendil fell, and Narsil broke beneath him; but Sauron himself was overthrown, and Isildur cut the Ring from his hand with the hilt-shard of his father's sword, and took it for his own.
Fruitless did I call the victory of the Last Alliance? Not wholly so, yet it did not achieve its end. Sauron was diminished, but not destroyed.
The realm of Gondor long endured; and for a while its splendour grew, recalling somewhat of the might of Nu´ menor, ere it fell.
In the days of Isildur the Ruling Ring passed out of all knowledge, and the Three were released from its dominion; but now in this latter day they are in peril once more.
It is perilous to study too deeply the arts of the Enemy, for good or for ill.
The world has changed much since I last was on the westward roads.
Time was when a squirrel could go from tree to tree from what is now the Shire to Dunland west of Isengard. In those lands I journeyed once, and many things wild and strange I knew.
There are other powers and realms that you know not, and they are hidden from you.
The Shadow has crept now to the feet of the Mountains, and draws nigh even to the borders of the Greyflood; and under the Shadow all is dark to me.
Such is of the course of deeds that move the wheels of the world: small hands do them because they must, while the eyes of the great are elsewhere.
Our list of allies grows thin.
I was there 3000 years ago. I was there the day the strength of men failed.
The sea call us home, yet I must remain until the last of my people depart.
Men are weak. The Blood of Númenor is all but spent, its pride and dignity forgotten.
We hold many relics of The West here in Imladris.
Imladris fought alongside the Kingdom of Arnor long ago. Now the Kingdom is ruined and its people scattered, but many of their relics are held here.
What brings you to me?
I have long forseen your coming, what brings you to my Homely House?
What tidings do you bring to the land of Imladris?
Welcome to the last Homely House in Middle-earth, #p.
May the stars shine upon your face!
Welcome to the House of Rivendell, #p.
Welcome to the valley of Imladris, the last Homely House of elves east of the Sea.
I have kept watch over this valley for many centuries.
You are always welcome in Imladris, #p.
The darkness that grows in the shadows will never find itself here, #p.
Dark forces move against us, the Nazgûl begin to prowl the lands of Eriador.
Ai! Mae govannen, arben na Imladris!
You have served my house well, #p.
Long have I been friends with the Dúnedain of the North.
The Dúnedain are the last of Númenor's once great people.
Ai! Mae govannen Dúnadan! Welcome to Imladris!
The Dúnedain of the North have always been welcome in my house.
I hold many relics of the Dúnedain here in Imladris.
The Sceptre of Annúminas is but one of the relics of Arnor still held in Imladris.
No evil may set foot in Imladris!
You may not enter Rivendell.
#p, you may not set foot in Rivendell!
The Enemy has no hold over Imladris!
Your darkness shall not poison the Last Homely House!
Na Imladris!
The Enemy has no hold over Imladris!
We suffer no evil in Imladris!
You may not bring evil here, #p!
Your shadow shall not poison our homely house!
Who brings to us this token of doom?
We shall not allow evil to enter our realm. Leave now or face our wrath!
You bring great evil here, #p. You can go no further.
Leave, #p, or face the might of our arrows!
No longer are you are welcome in our land!
I despair that we ever sheltered you in Imladris!
Bitterly now I regret welcoming you into Imladris!
